item.title: Bellman–Ford algorithm and Routing Information Protocol
item.description: There is an unacceptable solution for leetcode Minimum Height Trees due to time limit exceeded. But it’s an algorithm I didn’t know, so record it. It’s Bellman–Ford algorithm used in Routing Information Protocol. object computes shortest paths from a single source vertex to all of the other vertices in a weighted digraph.[1] It is slower than Dijkstra’s algorithm for the same problem, but more versatile, as it is capable of handling graphs in which some of the edge weights are negative numbers.
